text: The 2017 Women's Cricket World Cup in England was contested by eight teams. The top four teams in the 2014–16 ICC Women's Championship qualified automatically, while the other four places in the tournament were filled by the top four teams in the 2017 Women's World Cup Qualifier, a ten-team tournament. ==Automatic qualification== The top four teams in the eight-team 2014–16 ICC Women's Championship – Australia, England, New Zealand, and the West Indies – qualified automatically for the 2017 World Cup. The bottom four teams – India, South Africa, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka – qualified for the 2017 World Cup Qualifier."ICC Women’s World Cup 2017 logo unveiled" , ICC, 23 July 2016. Retrieved 30 July 2016. ==Regional qualification== ===Africa=== The Africa regional qualifier was held in Harare, Zimbabwe, from 23–26 April 2016, and featured four teams. Twelve matches were played, all of 20-over duration (rather than the 50 overs used at the World Cup). Zimbabwe was the winner, finishing undefeated in its six matches."Zimbabwe Women triumph in Africa Regional Qualifier for ICC Women's World Cup 2017" , ICC, 27 April 2016. Retrieved 30 July 2016. \---- {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background: #cfc;" | (Q) |Qualified for World Cup Qualifier |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Team !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=45| |- style="background:#cfc;" | align="left" | (Q) || 6 || 6 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 12 || +2.713 |- | align="left" | || 6 || 3 || 3 || 0 || 0 || 6 || –0.545 |- | align="left" | || 6 || 2 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 4 || +0.036 |- | align="left" | || 6 || 1 || 5 || 0 || 0 || 2 || –1.836 |- | colspan=8 align=right| |} \---- \---- ===Americas=== In 2013, the ICC announced that no Americas regional qualifier would be held for the 2017 World Cup, citing the poor quality of women's cricket in the region both in terms of play and administration. Consequently, the West Indies (by virtue of their participation in the ICC Women's Championship) will be the only team from the ICC Americas development region to participate in the qualifying process for the World Cup.Nadia T. Gruny, Report: ICC Americas Women's Cricket, USA Women's Cricket, 1 January 2014. Retrieved 30 July 2016. ===Asia=== The Asia regional qualifier was held in Hong Kong from 9–15 October 2016, with matches played at the Mission Road Ground, the Kowloon Cricket Club, and the Hong Kong Cricket Club. Four teams took part, and matches were of 20-over duration."Hong Kong to host ICC 2016 Women’s World Cup Qualifier - Asia" , ICC, 21 June 2016. Retrieved 30 July 2016. \---- {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background: #cfc;" | (Q) |Qualified for World Cup Qualifier |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Team !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=45| |- style="background: #cfc;" | align="left" | (Q) || 6 || 5 || 1 || 0 || 0 || 10 || +0.923 |- | align="left" | || 6 || 3 || 3 || 0 || 0 || 6 || +0.215 |- | align="left" | || 6 || 2 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 4 || –0.067 |- | align="left" | || 6 || 2 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 4 || –1.065 |} \---- \---- ===East Asia-Pacific=== The East Asia-Pacific regional qualifier was held in Apia, Samoa, from 15–22 July 2016, and featured three teams. Papua New Guinea was the winner, finishing undefeated in its four matches."PNG qualifies for ICC Women's World Cup Qualifier 2017" , ICC, 22 July 2016. Retrieved 30 July 2016. \---- {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background: #cfc;" | (Q) |Qualified for World Cup Qualifier |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Team !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=45| |- style="background:#cfc;" | align="left" | (Q) || 4 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 8 || +1.176 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 2 || 2 || 0 || 0 || 4 || –0.189 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 0 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 0 || –1.089 |- | colspan=8 align=right| |} \---- \---- ===Europe=== The Europe regional qualifier was held in Southend-on-Sea, Essex, England, from 12–15 July 2016. Only two teams participated, the Netherlands and Scotland, with Scotland winning all three matches. \---- {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background: #cfc;" | (Q) |Qualified for World Cup Qualifier |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Team !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=45| |- style="background:#cfc;" | align="left" | (Q) || 3 || 3 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 6 || +0.578 |- | align="left" | || 3 || 0 || 3 || 0 || 0 || 0 || –0.578 |- | colspan=8 align=right| |} \---- \---- ==World Cup Qualifier== The 2017 World Cup Qualifier was played in Colombo, Sri Lanka, in February 2017."Colombo to host ICC Women’s World Cup Qualifier 2017" , International Cricket Council, 30 October 2016.
